item.description:
Identity Art Exhibition - recommended by the Boston Globe and WGBH-2

 

Artists: Leslie Bordonaro, Nira Chorev, Shoshana Ernst, Sarah Kahn, Chung Shil Shim, Philip Spinks and Regina Valluzzi

 

Curated by John Quatrale

 

Exhibition dates:
April 23 – June 11, 2011

 

Location

Brighton-Allston Heritage Museum 20 Chestnut Hill Ave. Historic Brighton Center, MA 02135


Hours: Tuesday – Friday and second and fourth Saturday Noon - 4pm

The Heritage Museum is pleased to present Identity, a group art exhibition featuring seven contemporary regional artists: Leslie Bordonaro, Nira Chorev, Shoshana Ernst, Sarah Kahn, Chung Shil Shim, Philip Spinks and Regina Valluzzi.  It’s an exhibition of the identity and people and places that addresses the question: What’s your definable and recognizable identity? Included are 55 original paintings, collages, drawings and mixed media. Throughout the exhibition, there is strong attachment to memory as a means to understand and achieve identity.  The Heritage Museum opened in 2007 and this is their 9th exhibition.
item.why: The artists from the Identity Art Exhibition that I just curated are doing a "Talk- Back" and so its a good time to speak with some experienced and established regional artists. Hope those of you close to Allston & Brighton will be able to come.
